description: From in- +‎ fighting. Compare Middle English infighten (“to attack”), Old English infiht (“infighting”).

entries.meaning: Fighting or quarreling among the members of a single group or side.
examples: […]  the economic and financial mismanagement of Mahmoud Ahmadinejad’s government and chronic infighting within the regime have contributed to the economic chaos  […]

entries.meaning: (boxing) Fighting with one's opponent closer than arm's length.
examples: Tate predicted that Wills, famed for infighting, would have to change his tactics against Firpo to avoid being knocked "very loose."
